subclusters.subcluster_name: Mitonuclear Communication and Genomic Compatibility Theory
Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial ROS production causing oxidative damage to mtDNA leading to aging.
Emphasizes mitochondrial ROS as main source of oxidative damage and mtDNA mutations driving aging.
Describes ROS accumulation from mitochondria causing oxidative damage and mitochondrial dysfunction with age.
Focuses on ROS generation causing mtDNA damage and the role of mitochondrial DNA repair in aging.
Models mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage accumulation as drivers of aging.
Details mitochondrial superoxide production sites and ROS damage as causes of aging.
Describes ROS generation and cumulative oxidative damage to mtDNA leading to mitochondrial dysfunction.
Links mitochondrial ROS production and respiratory chain mutations to aging via oxidative damage.
Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA deletion mutations caused by oxidative damage driving aging phenotypes.
Emphasizes ROS as aging drivers causing mtDNA damage and oxidative damage accumulation.
Describes mitochondrial oxidative stress impairing energy metabolism and causing aging via ROS damage.
Highlights mitochondrial ROS production and oxidative damage feedback loop accelerating aging.
Proposes accumulation of mitochondrial oxidative damage as fundamental cause of aging and disease.
Links mtDNA mutations and ROS damage to aging and longevity via haplogroup associations.
Focuses on mitochondrial superoxide as primary ROS causing oxidative damage and aging.
Attributes aging to mitochondrial dysfunction and oxidative damage accumulation impairing energy production.
Describes mtDNA mutations causing oxidative stress, ATP decline, and mitochondrial membrane potential changes in aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Germline Quality Control and Sex Evolution Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitochondrial free radical mutagenesis, gamete specialization, and maternal inheritance preserving mtDNA integrity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitonuclear Communication and Genomic Compatibility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes bidirectional mitonuclear signaling, mitochondrial peptides, and genomic compatibility regulating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitonuclear Communication and Genomic Compatibility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on mitonuclear gene expression balance and evolutionary adaptations influencing lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitonuclear Communication and Genomic Compatibility Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links mitoribosomal protein deregulation to mitochondrial dysfunction, ROS, and telomere deprotection driving senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial DNA Mutation-Driven Stem Cell Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on accumulation of mtDNA mutations in stem cells causing respiratory defects and altered stem cell fate.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: MitomiR-Mediated Mitochondrial Dysfunction and Inflamm-Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitomiRs regulating mitochondrial integrity, apoptosis, and inflamm-aging via Bcl-2 family modulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial ROS-HIF Signaling and Telomerase Activation Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial ROS activate HIF under hypoxia, inducing telomerase and extending replicative lifespan.
Focuses on mitochondrial uncoupling proteins reducing ROS production and modulating lifespan via metabolic regulation.
Describes increased proton leak lowering ROS and associating higher metabolism with longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Respiration-Dependent Caloric Restriction Lifespan Extension Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows caloric restriction extends lifespan by improving mitochondrial respiration, balancing ROS and ATP.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes mitochondrial dysfunction, calcium dysregulation, and impaired dynamics/mitophagy driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on oxidative stress-induced mitochondrial cristae rearrangement and genetic regulation of mitochondrial homeostasis.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes mitochondrial thioredoxin system upregulation via mitoUPR enhancing stress resistance and longevity.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Proposes mitochondrial bioenergetics and topology govern aging via energetic capacity and molecular entropy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitochondrial Dysfunction, Dynamics, and Quality Control Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows exercise improves mitochondrial biogenesis and coupling efficiency, reversing age-related dysfunction.
